page.title: 17Thomas Tompion_Clockmaker
page.content: { Thomas Tompion}was a famous{English {Clockmaker.}Born in 1639 he lived in Ickwell and became a master of the Clockmakers company in 1704.He was one of the first people in England to make a{Balance spring.}Many of his clocks still exist.He made some superb Grandfather clocks which lasted a very long time and were accurate to the second. Many of his clocks are in the Bedford Museum to this day. Tompion's cottage still stands on Ickwell green.Built in the 16th century it has very low ceilings because people were smaller in those days.The interior walls are made of lath & plaster and the exterior walls are made of different materials.It has one wall at the back of the building which dates to 1700.The house is a private residence and is not open to the public.
